description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Kamakura" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Kamakura

places.generalDescription: Shichirigahama Beach, located in the Enoshima neighborhood, offers a clear view of Kamakurakokomae Station, famous for its appearance in the popular Slam Dunk basketball manga. While swimming is not allowed at this beach, it's still a pleasant place to relax and take in the stunning scenery.

sources.snippet: Shichirigahama Beach isn't suitable for swimming due to its steep shores, so you won't find cafes or changing rooms here. However, it is highly popular among surfers and offers breathtaking views of Enoshima Island and Mount Fuji. This beach has even been depicted in famous Japanese prints, including Hokusai's "36 Views of Fuji.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Kamakura: where to swim? Beach vacations in Kamakura

sources.snippet: Swimming is prohibited in Shichirigahama Beach and Inamuragasaki Beach. Both of them are perfect places for marine sports such as surfing. In addition, Shichirigahama Beach is a scenic spot that was selected as one of the 100 best beaches in Japan while Inamuragasaki Beach is a famous place for viewing sunsets.
sources.shortName: Kamakura's Seaside Resort: Recommended Beaches in Kamakura

sources.snippet: Surfing: Shichirigahama Beach is the main surfing destination in Kamakura, known for its excellent wave conditions. This beach tends to be less crowded, making it a great environment for surfers. The best seasons for surfing in Kamakura are spring and autumn, especially after the beach season ends.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches of Kamakura

sources.snippet: Swimming is prohibited on this beach, but its unique topography creates complex waves that make it a popular spot for surfing. On a clear day, you can see Enoshima and Mt. Fuji. The nearby railroad crossing is featured in the opening scene of the popular manga 'Slam Dunk,' attracting many visitors.
sources.shortName: Best Beach in Kamakura: 7 Beaches Near Kamakura

sources.snippet: ・Among these beaches, Zaimokuza Beach is particularly long and shallow, with gentle waves. Because of this, it can get crowded with tourists who come to swim every year. We carry out “cleaning and maintenance activities,” “safety and security operations,” and “secondhand smoke prevention measures.
sources.shortName: Zaimokuza Beach | Have fun in ZAIMOKUZA BEACH

sources.snippet: You couldn’t possibly visit Kamakura without a trip to the beach. 七里ヶ浜 (Shichirigahama) is beautiful on a sunny day, and there are usually a few surfers catching waves on any given day. Taking the train along the beach to enjoy the ocean view is one of my favorite activities.
sources.shortName: Kamakura Temples & Beaches

places.name: Shichirigahama Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach. No views of Mt. Fuji during our overcast visit. But beach and ocean views were great. Lots of seashells. Not crowded.

Shichirigahama Beach is absolutely stunning! Watching the waves crash and seeing surfers riding them was such a beautiful and calming experience. The view of the ocean with the horizon stretching out endlessly was pure magic. Whether you're just taking a walk, relaxing, or snapping some photos, this beach has a really special atmosphere.
Highly recommend if you're in Kamakura!
Beautiful and serene. Very nice beach with many eagles. It's also near a 7/11!

places.address: Japan, 〒248-0026 Kanagawa, Kamakura, Shichirigahamahigashi, 2-chōme−1, 七里ガ浜

places.generalDescription: Kanagawa Prefectural Shonan Coast Park is a stunning destination that offers a delightful blend of natural beauty and recreational activities. Stretching from Kamakura to Chigasaki, this long beach park is renowned for its vibrant surfing scene, making it a hotspot for both seasoned surfers and beginners alike. The picturesque backdrop of Enoshima Island enhances the experience, especially during sunset when the sky transforms into a canvas of colors with Mt. Fuji standing majestically in the distance.

sources.snippet: The Shonan Coast stretches over a few dozen kilometers along the shoreline of Kanagawa Prefecture. Many of the beaches along the Shonan Coast are popular for sunbathing and swimming, while surfing, windsurfing and stand-up paddle boarding can also be done at some of them. Being close to the city, the rules at some of the beaches can be fairly strict.
sources.shortName: Beaches near Tokyo

places.name: Kanagawa Prefectural Shonan Coast Park

reviews.text: Ideal for a walk along the beach. In winter you can see a beautiful Mount Fuji.

We watched the sun set over Mt Fuji, with surfers swimming in the sea. It was truly an amazing sight, I think it might be the best sunset I've seen in a long time!
There's free toilets as well (not super clean, but they do the job).
You can see a beautiful view of the Fuji mountain you can spend time here to get the best view of the Fuji This is the big lake so you can drive/cycling/Walk around it you can campaign here

places.generalDescription: Zushi Beach, located in Kanagawa Prefecture, is a popular coastal stretch known for its scenic views of Enoshima Island and Mount Fuji. The beach offers activities such as windsurfing, yachting, and paddleboarding. It features calm waters suitable for swimming and is surrounded by trendy cafes and restaurants offering various dining options. Additionally, the area boasts shops and cafes perfect for relaxation after a day of beach fun.

sources.snippet: Zushi Beach is extremely popular for all beach activities, and for those who need to stop to refuel on caffeine (or simply want to play spectator), the good news is that the coastline is dotted with coffee shops, bars and restaurants right by the action. Look out for Beach Muffin – a vegan cafe specializing in delicious handmade baked goods. The far end of the beach, by the marina, meanwhile, is one of the best spots for windsurfing near Tokyo.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: Located approximately one hour from Tokyo in  Kanagawa Prefecture,  Zushi Beach is known for its relaxed atmosphere and vibrant beach culture. It’s a popular spot for water sports such as windsurfing and paddle boarding. To get there, take the JR Yokosuka Line from  Tokyo Station to  Zushi Station, then take a short bus or 15-minute walk.
sources.shortName: 4 Beautiful Beaches Near Tokyo

places.name: Zushi Beach

reviews.text:
A Serene Beach Escape Near Tokyo – The Perfect Spot to Enjoy Nature

If you're looking for a peaceful beach getaway where you can truly immerse yourself in nature, this is the place to be. Located just under an hour from Tokyo, it offers a refreshing escape from the city's fast-paced energy. The moment you arrive, you'll notice the crystal-clear water and the calm, gentle waves, making it an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, or simply relaxing by the shore. Unlike many other beaches, this one is remarkably clean, with very little litter, allowing visitors to fully enjoy the natural beauty without distractions.

One of the best things about this location is the balance between tranquility and convenience. While the beach itself is serene and uncrowded, there are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby, making it easy to grab a delicious meal or a refreshing drink after a day by the sea. Whether you're planning a romantic getaway, a solo retreat, or a fun day out with friends and family, this beach has something for everyone.

For those who love photography or simply enjoy breathtaking views, the scenery here is spectacular-especially during sunrise and sunset, when the sky paints the ocean in stunning shades of orange and pink. If you're looking for a stress-free, nature-filled beach experience without traveling too far from Tokyo, this hidden gem is an absolute must-visit!

I took the train from Ishigawa and arrived at Zushi around 4PM. Consider that bathing is allowed during lifeguard's working hours (until 5PM). I Went directly to the beach. Tere were not a lot of people. You are met by a sign explaining the rules at the beach and considering that I have large tattoos over my body, I decided that I won't try my luck, so I just dipped my toes. The water was very warm, the sand is fine - like silk. At this time the beach was relatively quiet, considering that it's the beginning of the school year and it's kind of late. I managed to capture the sun going down - beautiful and fulfilling picture.
There are some bars and other venues which I did not visit, because it was after or near their closing time.
The beach was generally clean, but still there was some trash left here and there (also some thrown by the sea), hence the 4 stars.
Still a great place to visit!

Seems to be popular among people.
The toilets can be little dirty. The restaurant/beach huts don't allow to use their restrooms. You can take some stuff as rental from any of the restaurants/beach huts.
The parking was around 500yen for 30mins.

places.generalDescription: Isshiki Beach, located in Zushi City near Kamakura, is a serene and picturesque sandy retreat that offers a more tranquil alternative to the popular Zushi Beach. Surrounded by rock formations and lush greenery, this beach provides a peaceful escape just a short bus ride away from the bustling city of Tokyo. With its gentle waters and stunning views of Mt. Fuji on clear days, Isshiki Beach has garnered attention as one of the best beaches in the world.

sources.snippet: Just a 15-minute bus ride away from busy Zushi lies pretty Isshiki Beach. It’s distinctly quieter than its surrounding neighborhoods, largely thanks to the rock formations and greenery that create a coastal enclave. The fact that there is no direct train access gives Isshiki Beach more of a local feel.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

places.name: Isshiki Beach

reviews.text: The beach is right next to the museum and the emperor's villa. The kids loved this beach because there were so many crabs on the rocks! We can also rent boats, fishing rods, etc. Water quality is very good!

It is ok to escape Tokyo on a sunny weekend day. The beach is reasonable, waves are gentle, perfect for small kids. There is absolutely no structure: no shower, toilets, shops, nothing. A few school giving stand up and life saving classes. The water is cold but not freezing.

Relaxing beach right on the coast of Hayama. Went on a Saturday afternoon and it was quite crowded, the same level as neighboring beaches such as Zushi, and parking is difficult and expensive (400 yen for 20 minutes), if you can find a spot. Water is much nicer than other spots , and has some beach houses that don't interfere with the atmosphere. Good for families and smaller groups, saw lots of dogs and kids.
No showers unless you want to pay, there's a public toilet, and you can pay to dispose some trash as well.

places.address: 1083 Horiuchi, Hayama, Miura District, Kanagawa 240-0111, Japan

places.generalDescription: Katase Higashihama Beach, located in an urban cove, is a popular spot for surfing and relaxation. It has beach bars and eateries, as well as a low-tide causeway to an island. The beach was recognized as one of the 88 most recommended beaches in Japan by the Ministry of the Environment.

sources.snippet: If you're short on time, head to Katase Higashihama, right by Enoshima Island. Just a short walk from the station, the spot has a more relaxed attitude to tattoos, alcohol and pets, and boasts a huge range of amenities including toilets, showers, chair and umbrella rentals, parking, shops and restaurants. It's not the prettiest because the dark sand looks a bit like cigarette ash, but you can hardly see it for all the beach umbrellas.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: This beach is a bay with shallow waters and calm waves, offering a beautiful view that has earned it a place among Japan's top 55 beaches. Renowned as one of the best beaches in the Kamakura/Shonan area, they also strive to keep the beach safe by regularly picking up trash, aiming to make it the safest beach in Japan where children can run around barefoot. Address: 1 Chome-15-1 Katasekaigan, Fujisawa, Kanagawa 251-0035, Japan
sources.shortName: Best Beach in Kamakura: 7 Beaches Near Kamakura

sources.snippet: It’s not commonly known, but actually Katase Higashihama Beach has a rich and culturally diverse history as being one of the first western style swimming beaches in Japan, a title which can be traced back to the city’s time in the Meiji Era. Nishihama Beach is a watersports lover's paradise and was where surfing and beach volleyball were first enjoyed in Japan.
sources.shortName: The Beaches of Enoshima | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet: Katase Higashihama Beach, or Enoshima Beach, located near the famous  Enoshima Island, is a favorite among Tokyoites for its lively beach culture and beautiful scenery. Take the Odakyu Line from  Shinjuku Station to Katase-Enoshima Station to reach it. The beach offers stunning views of Mount Fuji on clear days and a variety of water activities.
sources.shortName: 4 Beautiful Beaches Near Tokyo

places.name: Katase Higashihama Beach

reviews.text: Many surfers were busy near the beach with their surfing boards. Some restaurants are beside the beach. Fuji san can also be seen from the beach, though very far away.

The beach is wide and the waves are moderate.  If they are a little rougher you could almost surf.  The sand is grey and fine grained.   The beach area is reasonably clean, but there is still garbage here and there.
I really like to go in this beach, it's not far away from Tokyo which makes it incredibly convenient.

places.generalDescription: Kamakura Yuigahama Beach is a popular destination for both locals and tourists due to its convenient location near the city center, clean sandy shores, and ideal waves for surfing. Visitors can enjoy swimming, beach facilities, and nearby eateries at this long stretch of coastline. After exploring the historical attractions in Kamakura, such as the Daibutsu-ji 'big Buddha,' travelers can head to Yuigahama Beach for some fun in the sun.

sources.snippet: **There are three public beaches in Kamakura: Zaimokuza, Yuigahama, and Koshigoe, which attract visitors to enjoy all sorts of marine sports, like sailing, surfing, sea kayaking, and windsurfing, or just swimming and sunbathing. Right down the street from Kamakura Station, Yuigahama is one of the most popular beaches in Japan.
sources.shortName: Kamakura | Japan | Culture | Travel

sources.snippet: Yuigahama Beach is crowded with many visitors every year from July to August. Since it is a shallow beach, tourists especially children can swim safely. During the sea bathing season, there are about 20 "Uminoya" (seaside restaurants) on the beach that sell food such as ramen and yakisoba, and also goods for sea bathing.
sources.shortName: Kamakura's Seaside Resort: Recommended Beaches in Kamakura

sources.snippet: ・Among these beaches, Zaimokuza Beach is particularly long and shallow, with gentle waves. Because of this, it can get crowded with tourists who come to swim every year. We carry out “cleaning and maintenance activities,” “safety and security operations,” and “secondhand smoke prevention measures.
sources.shortName: Zaimokuza Beach | Have fun in ZAIMOKUZA BEACH

sources.snippet: In recent years, Yuigahama Beach has become popular for its famous restaurants, and beach houses that have been designed in collaboration with fashion brands. It has become a swimming area that even adults can enjoy.
sources.shortName: Kamakura Beach - Kamakura Things To Do & Itineraries

sources.snippet: When it comes to beaches in Kamakura, Yuigahama is particularly famous and attracts many visitors year-round. This beach has been selected as one of the top 100 Kamakura landscapes and is a must-visit beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beach in Kamakura: 7 Beaches Near Kamakura

sources.snippet: Around 4:30 PM, it is best to head to Yuigahama Beach on Sagami Bay. It is best to have something warm to drink during the sunset as winters in Japan can be quite chilly.
sources.shortName: Watching sunset on the beach in Kamakura city

sources.snippet: Yuigahama is the closest beach to the famous town of Kamakura, and one station up from Zushi on the Yokosuka Line. And what difference does one station make here?
sources.shortName: The Ugly but Amusing Beaches near Tokyo: Part 3 – Yuigahama (Kamakura) Beach

sources.snippet: Popular points of interest near the accommodation include Yuigahama Beach, Zaimokuza Beach and Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine. Tokyo Haneda Airport is 40 km away.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Kamakura

sources.snippet: Yuigahama Beach: From Kamakura Station, it is a 15-minute walk. The beach is only five minutes from Wadazuka, Yuigahama and Hase stations on the Enoden Line.
sources.shortName: Kamakura Beaches | Travel Japan
Yuigahama Beach - Kamakura Travel Tips - Japan Travel Guide
10 Best beach trails in Kamakura

places.name: Kamakura Yuigahama Beach

reviews.text: Yuigahama Beach in Kamakura offers a laid-back vibe with stunning ocean views. The beach is perfect for a peaceful walk, sunbathing, or enjoying water sports. Surrounded by cafes and shops, it's an ideal spot to relax after exploring Kamakura's temples.

I was truly impressed by my trip to Kamakura. This beautiful town has such a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and the locals are incredibly friendly. One of the highlights was driving along the scenic coastal road of Kanagawa – absolutely breathtaking, especially on a sunny day. During the road trip, I noticed lots of people out enjoying the sea, many with surfboards ready for a swim. The area also had charming garage sales and local stalls dotted along the way, adding to the laid-back, seaside vibe. Kamakura is a perfect blend of nature, culture, and community – definitely a place worth visiting again.

Lovely spot to visit after either a visit to the Buddha or hiking behind the Buddha. Water is clean and with some waves . Surfers are there catching them . There is a lifeguard watching in designated spots. As well, you can get an umbrella or chair at any of the nearby beach restaurants for a fee.

places.generalDescription: Katase Nishihama Beach is a wide, family-friendly beach with shallow waters and opportunities for surfing. It offers stunning views of Mount Fuji and is conveniently located near Enoshima Island, accessible via the Enoshima Bentenbashi Bridge. The area around the beach features numerous restaurants and souvenir shops, including those offering local gourmet products like tako senbei (octopus rice crackers).

sources.snippet: This beach, about 1 km long, is one of the best beaches in the Kamakura/Shonan area. It attracts many visitors year-round for marine sports, offering views of Enoshima to the left and Mt. Fuji to the right. During the summer, n umerous beach houses open, making the area very crowded.
sources.shortName: Best Beach in Kamakura: 7 Beaches Near Kamakura
The Beaches of Enoshima | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

places.name: Katase Nishihama beaches

reviews.text: Easy walk from the local train stations, it has toilets and areas to get changed. The beach is safe and very clean. Well worth  visit on a sunny day.

Went here with my husband, son and group of friends to spend the weekend! A nice beach for a stroll - it has lots of small waves so good for kids. Along the beach line there are many beach houses offering food and drinks, some also have paid shower and locker rentals. It took about 1.5 - 2 hours train trip from Shinjuku station. One of the reccomended place for a short outing.

Nothing can beat the view here
Either sunset view of mt.fuji or the morning view of beach and mt.fuji
Would love to go back
There are a walking path along the beach

places.generalDescription: Zaimokuza Beach in Kamakura is a well-maintained and clean beach with gentle waves, making it perfect for swimmers of all ages. During the summer, lifeguards ensure a safe experience. Rules restrict bringing drinks or having barbecues on the sand. This seaside town has a laid-back California surfer vibe and Zaimokuza Beach offers more space compared to the popular Yuigahama Beach.

sources.snippet: Though Kamakura is only a one-hour train ride from Tokyo, this seaside town, complete with a laid-back California surfer vibe, feels a world away. Of Kamakura's five beaches, Yuigahama is the most popular, and the first one you reach if you're walking from the train station; it can also get incredibly crowded, especially on weekends. For more space, keep walking instead to Zaimokuza, a broad stretch of sand fronted by waters that are generally gentle.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches near Tokyo

sources.snippet: 2 other beaches: Zaimokuza Beach (材木座) and Koshigoe Beach (腰越). These beaches are less popular among tourists. Zaimokuza Beach is famous in Japan because it was the setting for the novel 'Heart' (Kokoro, こころ) by the famous Japanese writer Natsume Sōseki (夏目 漱石).
sources.shortName: Best Beaches of Kamakura

sources.snippet: Zaimokuza Beach, with a history spanning over 130 years, is one of the best beaches in Kamakura. The sea is shallow and calm, making it safe for children. The beach has a sandy  bottom with no rocky areas, minimizing potential hazards.
sources.shortName: Best Beach in Kamakura: 7 Beaches Near Kamakura

sources.snippet: Zaimokuza Beach is a shallow beach next to the Yuigahama beach. It is divided into Swimming Area and Swimming Prohibited Area. Activities such as boating and windsurfing can be enjoyed at the swimming prohibited area.
sources.shortName: Kamakura's Seaside Resort: Recommended Beaches in Kamakura

sources.snippet: The picturesque Inamuragasaki Beach is renowned for its stunning sunsets, often featuring prominently in Japanese movies. This beach serves as a popular filming location for many Japanese films.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Kamakura: where to swim? Beach vacations in Kamakura

sources.snippet: Popular points of interest near the accommodation include Yuigahama Beach, Zaimokuza Beach and Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine. Tokyo Haneda Airport is 40 km away.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Kamakura

sources.snippet: There are 5 beaches spanning the 7 km long coast: Zaimokuza Beach, Yuigahama Beach, Inamuragasaki Beach, Shichirigahama Beach, and Koshigoe Beach.
sources.shortName: Zaimokuza Beach | Have fun in ZAIMOKUZA BEACH

places.name: Kamakura Zaimokuza Beach

reviews.text: Considering it was an evening in late December, there were surprisingly quite a few people still at the beach. I had a nice walk along the shore but it didn't seem like there were many facilities. Do note this rating is heavily biased as I love beaches.

Zaimokuza Beach is one of the closest beaches to Tokyo, making it an easy day trip. It does get quite crowded, and from what I observed, it feels more like a beach for tourists rather than locals.

The sand is darker, more black than white, which shouldn't come as a surprise in this region, though I've heard mixed opinions about it.

On the positive side, the beach itself is kept very clean. Litter is rare because it's regularly maintained. Unfortunately, the water in the bay tells a different story, it's dirty and filled with trash, which is disappointing to see.

The beach area itself is spacious, and when we visited in mid-August, the water was wonderfully warm, so warm that you didn't want to get out, if not for the scorching sun and blazing heat above.

Facilities are abundant: there are many beach bars, showers, lifeguard stations, and plenty of rental spots where you can get sunbeds, umbrellas, and all kinds of water toys and gear.

But here comes the worst part, the toilets. Portable Toi Toi cabins. Honestly, the worst experience ever. I can't recommend them at all!

Not worth going all the way to this beach when visiting Kamakura. The place has amazing temples, pretty distant from each other, and a lively shopping street. Going down the beach is time consuming and not worth it. The beach is not particularly nice, not really used for bathing and there are no facilities. I wish we had skipped it and spent more time sightseeing temples.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Kamakura, Guesthouse Kamakura ZEN-JI offers modest accommodations with a cozy lounge featuring tatami mats and a serene courtyard garden. Situated just 300 meters from Yuigahama Beach, this 2-star guest house provides beachfront lodging with a garden view and is conveniently close to Zaimokuza Beach. With facilities for disabled guests, it's an ideal base for exploring the area.

sources.snippet: Located in Kamakura, just 300 metres from Yuigahama Beach, Guest House Kamakura Zen-ji provides beachfront accommodation with a garden, a shared lounge and free WiFi. The 2-star guest house features garden views and is 1.4 km from Zaimokuza Beach. The guest house has facilities for disabled guests.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Kamakura

places.name: Guesthouse Kamakura ZEN-JI

reviews.text: The host is nice, house is clean and has the immersive Japanese style. And you could walk to the sea to see the sunrise in few minutes.

INCREDIBLE!!!! Was so peaceful here, I was finally able to settle down and feel like home for the first time in my two months traveling. Staff is SO kind and do everything they can to take care of you. This place is simply wonderful and if I ever come back to this area, I will always stay here.

This place had a fantastic, serene vibe and is a great place to stay to visit the town and beach area. The common room/area is very relaxing, and also contains the showers.

The man who greeted us was very quick to get there from wherever he lives, and gave us a great intro to the place, cold water to drink (it was a hot day in July), and then chatted with us about our vacation, where we lived, etc. A very good soul in a good place in his life. He gave us meal suggestions and other local advice.

The woman who was there when we checked out was also very kind and talkative.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Kamakura, guesthouse SHIBAFU is a cozy retreat with two simple rooms, a charming cafe/bar, and a rooftop garden. This 1-star guest house provides a convenient and comfortable stay, offering amenities such as air conditioning, luggage storage space, and a shared lounge. Its prime location allows easy access to Yuigahama Beach and Zaimokuza Beach while being within close proximity to local train stations. Perfect for short getaways or weekend trips!

sources.snippet: Situated in Kamakura, 600 metres from Yuigahama Beach and 1.3 km from Zaimokuza Beach, guesthouse SHIBAFU features accommodation with air conditioning and access to a garden. This 1-star guest house offers luggage storage space and a shared lounge. Yokohama Marine Tower is 23 km away and Nissan Stadium is 32 km from the guest house.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Kamakura

places.name: guesthouse SHIBAFU

reviews.text: The staff is super friendly and helped me carry the luggage to the room also helped me take downstairs. Also helped me call a taxi even helped me pull my luggage to outside waiting for me get on the cab and left ! It's so rare even in Taiwan they won't help you to do that ! The food I had the night before was super tasty . It's next to the guesthouse, I think it's also belonging to the guesthouse, because the staff was the same guy who help me carry my luggage upstairs. I chose grilled steak with veggies and the appetite was also great ! Super delicious! It even tastes better than a proper restaurant! And people were in the bar super friendly and helped me up my journey in Kamakura told me which ways I go would saved my time. Let me feel super warm and like that place so much ! One day trip was too short there are so many beautiful places to see ! I would definitely come back again and stay more days here next year! Thanks for helping me ! ❤️

Very nice place to stay. Everything is pretty clean, the building is very cozy and the owner very friendly. The room we stayed at was very clean but kinda small for two grown adults. You meet very nice people and can also join the bar/restaurant next doors owned by the same people.

The owner is very nice, he carried my heavy suitcase all the way to my room. The price is reasonable and size of the room is good enough for 1 people or 2 skinny people.

However the wall is extremely thinnnnnn, the girl next to me, she talks on the phone all the time and I can hear her very clearly just like she is sitting right next to me, and I asked her to be quite and she said okay but reminded me that it's not 11pm yet.

Honestly I would rather stay in a capsule hotel than the guesthouse like this. Cuz most of the people from outside of Japan don't really care about others, like living in a guesthouse like this, especially the wall is thin, I mean you can talk but just lower down your voice and respect others, jeez.

places.generalDescription: Shichirigahama is a picturesque sand beach and sunset spot that offers stunning views of Mount Fuji and Enoshima island. It's a popular destination for surfers looking to catch some waves. Visitors can enjoy gourmet breakfasts and delicious cafe fare from Australian celebrity chef Bill Granger. The area is known for its beautiful sunsets, making it the perfect place to relax after a day of surfing or exploring nearby attractions like Kamakura Kokomae Station and the Great Buddha statue.
places.name: Shichirigahama

reviews.text:
There's not one, but 7 "ri" in this Gahama beach, whatever that means according to a certain rascal.
Also got my fried chicken stolen from a bird.  10/10 experience

Magnificent Fuji San. This sunset hues reminded me of ukiyoe 浮世絵.

Just be careful that after sunset shooting was gone so was the crowd and the crowded as ever train.

Slam dunk is one of the most famous and popular animes in the world. It is based on Kamakura kokomae station and if you walk for 10 mins, you can arrive at this beach area. You can fully enjoy the amazing beach and recommend visiting here around the sunset time.
